thread.title: Man who worked as volunteer firefighter charged with arson
thread.title_full: Man who worked as volunteer firefighter charged with arson - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Man who worked as volunteer firefighter charged with arson
text:
BATON ROUGE, La. (AP) - A Jonesboro man who worked as a volunteer firefighter has been arrested and charged with setting six fires in the woods of Jackson Parish during 2010 and 2011.
The State Fire Marshal's Office and the Louisiana Department of Agriculture and Forestry say in a news release that 22-year-old Justin L. Murphy was arrested Friday. He is charged with six counts of simple arson.
Bond was set at $90,000. It was not immediately clear whether Murphy has an attorney.
The news release says that as a volunteer for the Jonesboro Fire Department, Murphy was paid $10 for every call to on a grass fire and $25 for every call to a woods fire.
